result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marlon Tremaine Miller

records.addlTxt:
9:13 AM Marlon Miller in court in custody. Attorney Rosenthal in court for defendant. Attorney Mark Fruehauf in court for the State. Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests status in about 60 days. State is in agreement. Court notes motion for bail modification. Attorney Rosenthal notes that bail was previously set at $4,000 cash. No use or possession of alcohol. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a dangerous weapon including firearms. No contact with Victim, her children or her residence. Asks that bail be modified to $1,000 cash. Defendant has been in jail for 39 days and cannot post. Has ties to the area and has family in kids in the area. Acknowledges previous FTAs. Notes that this is his first felony charge, MN charge was plead to as a felony but was amended down after completion of probation. State opposes reduction, notes seriousness of the charges and fleeing charge. State recites previous convictions in Minnesota and Illinois. Notes that the defendant is currently on unsupervised probation in MN for DWI conviction. State recites that defendant failed to appear on $1,000 cash bail, and failed to appear in that case again when additional money was ordered.
Court reviews the factors for setting bail and notes defendant has been bound over for further proceedings. 
Court denies the motion for bail modification.
Defendant's notice of motion and motion to modify bail conditions

No use or possession of alcohol. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a dangerous weapon including firearms. No contact with Victim, her children or her residence.

3:36 PM Defendant Marlon Tremaine Miller appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Reid appears in person for Defendant. Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Address is Ruth House in Superior. Attorney Reid acknowledges complaint, waives reading, enters not guilty pleas, request preliminary hearing. Court accepts pleas. 
State requests $7,500 cash, with no driving, no alcohol, no firearms, no contact with Victim, her children or the residence. Cites priors. 
Attorney Reid indicates no FTA's. Lives in Douglas County 6 years. Asks for signature bond or low cash. 
State indicates has a prior FTA in 2018. 
Court orders $4,000 cash with conditions of no use or possession of alcohol, no driving without valid permit or license, no dangerous weapons including firearms, no contact with Victim 1, her children or her residence.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
